title: Mobile Microlearning Design for Evaluating Educational Technology Effectiveness

context.prior_knowledge: Basic digital literacy and advanced expertise in social sciences
context.additional_context: Social studies curriculum conducted in smartphone-centric limited technological environments. Learners assume roles as ordinary citizens, with the goal of strengthening competency in effectiveness evaluation using technology-based tools

learning_goals: Learners can classify evaluation criteria for the effectiveness of educational technology tools across six categories (knowledge tools, problem-solving tools, production tools, etc.).
Learners can apply and assess design principles for technology-based learning tools in mobile environments.
Learners can explain methods for measuring educational technology effectiveness with over 80% accuracy through real-case analysis.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
